Hi,
Short question:
How can I implement my own custom logic for saving file=
s? Is there a sample? Please guide me.

Long description:
I have a very big=
 project which needs a good crawler. It is used mainly for archiving web pa=
ges but in a special way. My previous solution was to use crawler4j because=
 it let me easily use my own code for processing downloaded contents. Howev=
er, due to numerous limitations, I had to move to a better crawler and Heri=
trix seemed like the perfect choice.

My question is, how can I create my o=
wn custom logic for saving documents?

So far, I have downloaded the projec=
t's source, imported it in Eclipse and added the .jar files from the downlo=
aded distributed package to classpath. Then I passed the required arguments=
 to the org.archive.crawler.Heritrix class and it doesn't contain any error=
s and I can access to the web UI. Although it is a little different from wh=
at I read in the documentation. (for instance it doesn't contain any tabs).=
 Is there something wrong here or is this the new UI for 3.1?

Now, back to=
 my question? What should I do to manually handle saving documents? I want =
to download EVERY file type on the web. I want to be able to get the docume=
nt type because I have to handle HTMLs, JS files, CSS files and other types=
 differently. And there is a chance that at some points, I need to pause ot=
her threads, do some work and then resume the work in order to safely save =
files on the disk.

I'm faily new to Heritrix and I'm reading the documenta=
tion as fast as I can. However I'd appreciate if you could point me in the =
right direction since I have to deliver this soon and I can't delay the pro=
ject for much.
